sen.j: 紀皇女（きのひめみこ 生没年不明）は、飛鳥時代の皇族。
sen.e: Ki no himemiko (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the imperial family who lived in the Asuka period.
Ki no himemiko (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family who lived in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: Ki no himemiko (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family who lived in the Asuka period.

sen.j: 天武天皇の皇女で、母は蘇我赤兄の娘、大蕤娘。
sen.e: Her father was the Emperor Tenmu, and her mother was Onu no iratsume, who was a daughter of SOGA no Akae.
Her father was the Emperor Tenmu, and her mother was Onu no iratsume, who was a daughter of SOGA no Akae.
Her father was the Emperor Tenmu, and her mother was Onu no iratsume, who was a daughter of SOGA no Akae.

sen.j: 同母兄は穂積親王、同母の妹は田形皇女。
sen.e: Her older maternal half-brother was Imperial Prince Hozumi, and her younger maternal half-sister was Takata no himemiko.
Her older brother-uterine was the Imperial Prince Hozumi, and her younger sister-uterine was Takata no himemiko.
sen.cmt: maternal half-brother→brother-uterine,maternal half-sister→sister-uterine と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: Her older brother-uterine was the Imperial Prince Hozumi, and her younger sister-uterine was Takata no himemiko.

sen.j: 他の天武天皇の皇女達と違って、彼女に関する記録はほとんどない。
sen.e: Unlike other princesses of the Emperor Tenmu, few of her records remain.
Unlike other princesses of the Emperor Tenmu, few of her records remain.
Unlike other princesses of the Emperor Tenmu, few of her records remain.

sen.j: 弓削皇子からの相聞歌が万葉集2・119～122にあるが、弓削皇子と結婚したという史料はない。
sen.e: Although Nos. 119 to 122 in the book two of Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) are romantic poems exchanged between Yuge no miko (Prince Yuge), there are no historical documentation that attests to their marriage.

Although Nos. 119 to 122 in the volume two of Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) are the romantic poems exchanged between her and Yuge no miko (the Prince Yuge), there are no historical documentation that attests to their marriage.
sen.cmt: book→volume と修正しました。the, her and を補いました。
sen.e: Although Nos. 119 to 122 in the volume two of Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) are the romantic poems exchanged between her and Yuge no miko (the Prince Yuge), there are no historical documentation that attests to their marriage.

sen.j: 文武天皇の妻になったという説（梅原猛『黄泉の王』）もあるがこれも真相は不明である。
sen.e: One theory has it that she married the Emperor Monmu ("Yomi no Okimi," Takeshi UMEHARA), but the truth is unknown
One theory has it that she married the Emperor Monmu ("Yomi no Okimi," Takeshi UMEHARA), but the truth is unknown.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを補いました。
sen.e: One theory has it that she married the Emperor Monmu ("Yomi no Okimi," Takeshi UMEHARA), but the truth is unknown.

sen.j: また万葉集には高安王に嫁いで責められたとあるが、これは紀皇女ではなく託基皇女ではないかという説（吉永登）もある。
sen.e: Manyoshu states that she was blamed for marrying Takayasu no okimi (Prince Takayasu), but one theory has it that it was Taki no himemiko (Princess Taki) who married him (Noboru YOSHINAGA).
Manyoshu states that she was blamed for marrying Takayasu no okimi (the Prince Takayasu), but one theory (by Noboru YOSHINAGA) has it that it was Taki no himemiko (the Princess Taki) who married him.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。(by Noboru YOSHINAGA)とし、オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: Manyoshu states that she was blamed for marrying Takayasu no okimi (the Prince Takayasu), but one theory (by Noboru YOSHINAGA) has it that it was Taki no himemiko (the Princess Taki) who married him.
